name: Watering Needs
description: Requires regular watering to keep the soil moist but not soggy.
uses: Helps in faster plant growth and prevents dehydration.
medicines: Used in Ayurvedic treatments for hydration.
application: Best for home gardening and large-scale farms.

name: Sunlight Requirements
description: Spinach grows best in full sun but can tolerate partial shade.
uses: Essential for photosynthesis and healthy growth.
application: Ideal for rooftop gardens and indoor farming.

name: Soil Preparation
description: Prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0.
uses: Ensures better root development and higher yield.
medicines: Improves soil health for medicinal herb farming.
application: Recommended for organic farming and hydroponic systems.

name: Temperature Conditions
description: Best grown in cool weather between 10°C to 24°C.
uses: Prevents bolting and promotes leafy growth.
application: Suitable for temperate and subtropical regions.

name: Fertilizer Requirements
description: Requires nitrogen-rich fertilizers like compost or organic manure.
uses: Boosts leaf production and plant health.
medicines: Organic fertilizers enhance medicinal plant growth.
application: Used in sustainable and organic farming practices.

name: Pest Control
description: Common pests include aphids, leaf miners, and caterpillars.
uses: Using neem oil or companion planting prevents infestations.
medicines: Neem extracts are used in organic pest control solutions.
application: Best for eco-friendly farming and natural gardens.

name: Harvesting Time
description: Spinach can be harvested 4-6 weeks after planting.
uses: Ensures continuous harvesting for fresh supply.
medicines: Used in fresh and dried spinach-based health supplements.
application: Ideal for home gardeners and commercial production.

name: Storage & Preservation
description: Best stored in cool, humid conditions at 0°C with high humidity.
uses: Extends shelf life for fresh market sales.
medicines: Dried spinach is used in herbal powders and supplements.
application: Essential for food industries and large-scale production.

name: Disease Management
description: Common diseases include downy mildew and root rot.
uses: Practicing crop rotation and using disease-resistant varieties helps.
medicines: Organic antifungal treatments are used in plant care.
application: Beneficial for organic and sustainable farming methods.

name: Spinach Varieties
description: Varieties include Savoy, Semi-Savoy, and Flat-leaf spinach.
uses: Each type has unique culinary and nutritional benefits.
medicines: Used in diet-based therapies for iron deficiency.
application: Best suited for both commercial and home gardening.
